amendment.description: Amendment sought to restore $12 million in funding to Superfund enforcement within the Hazardous Substance Superfund account and cut the Bureau of Land Management account oil and gas leasing program by a similar amount.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 2 printed in House Report 115-297 to restore funding to Superfund enforcement within the Hazardous Substance Superfund account with an equivalent cut to the oil and gas program within the BLM account.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Grijalva amendment (A061) Failed by recorded vote: 191 - 221 (Roll no. 471).

action.text: Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Grijalva amendment (A061) Failed by recorded vote: 191 - 221 (Roll no. 471).
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A061) offered by Mr. Grijalva.
